turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I'll take your abuse, but it's way too early for the sanctimonious Cult of Gag...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh, so now even the keepers of the city don't meet your standards...You're late.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Don't sneak up on me...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Uh, it's just--that woman out there-- that horrible Hag. She's the one who keeps following me on her creepy little scooter--And now she's built a hut in the back..Why did you...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Because she asked me--and I couldn't very well turn her down. Don't you remember-- of course you don't remember--that "Hag" is the one who brought you to that hospital in Gotham City. For what it's worth-- currently not much--we owe her your life...When I think about a single woman in Gotham City--amnesia is probably the best thing that could happen to a girl like you...Oh, don't forget your visor.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Where were you last night?  I didn't hear you come in.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: It's because I didn't come in. I live in the Hut, now. I meant to tell you..See ya.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Mom?  Oh Mom, I messed up...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: What kind of name is "Brock Leviathan?"

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I never thanked you..the arrow..the motorcycle..the computer disc..You're so different from what I..and so the same.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Yes, I'm pretty amazing. You should see this...It came this evening.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: They're going to attack Frank's Fun Palace!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I hate it when you let your hair just hang like that...you have such pretty eyes...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Mom, not now!  I, I don't know what to do..

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Yes, you do. You have to go rescue all those people...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: But I'm not a hero. I'm nobody's heroine..I'm nothing. You've said so yourself many times.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Do you always listen to what your mother says?  Selina. Something you choose your life. Sometimes your life chooses you.  Save the day..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: I don't know if I can do it alone.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Trust me, you won't have to.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: What's a powerful man like you standing all alone for?  Dance with me?

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Miss, one of us needs to keep surveillance...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Oh pooh, come now. If you turn me down, I just might throw a fit..you know how us girls can be..

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: What's it like being a superhero?  It must be frightfully exciting..How did you guys all get together?

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: We met on the Internet. The Captain put out a cryptic message calling for a new order of crimefighters. We don't even know each other's true identities...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You seem sad, Spooky.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: I'm not sad, no, I owe the Captain my life. It's just you think you want to help prevent crime, but you realize that's too complicated. It's a lot more fun to punish crime. Then after a while, you don't care what's a crime and what's not, what you became a Warrior for. You just want the kicks. The rush.

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: The kicks..the rush..you mean, like pulling heists..faking your own deaths..killing innocent bystanders...like Mexican angels.  I know you're a woman. Do you?

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: You're the One. I thought I told you to stay hidden behind the couch, CAT! You've torn the unit apart.  You've driven a great leader insane...

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: You going to talk all day?

turns.speaker: SELINA
turns.text: Nice breasts.

turns.speaker: SPOOKY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Hey Buddy!  Can you let me pull over?  Give me some space to pull over.

turns.speaker: 2ND DRIVER
turns.text: Where do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Any place.

turns.speaker: 2ND DRIVER
turns.text: This is one way.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I know.  But it's an emergency. Somebody dying.  Okay?

turns.speaker: 2ND DRIVER
turns.text: I don't see anybody in there but you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I would appreciate a little space. Thank you.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Was someone in an accident?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Do I hear a woman's voice?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: I'm sorry for whatever's happened to you but we're definitely not the right people to do you any good.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Don't you have children?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Matter of fact I did have a kid once.  But he's a lot better off with his father in Milwaukee.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: What are you doing on Theo's line?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Taking messages.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: He ran out on me to be with you? Well fuck him!  Everything worked twice as good without him.  We didn't need him then and I don't need him now.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm sure he'll be heartbroken.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: I know he's there!  He doesn't even have the balls to pick up the phone!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I won't let him.  He belongs to me now.  Bye, sweetie.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Be careful.  There were people in that crosswalk.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: That's all we need.  Better let me drive.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Have you got to tell her your life story?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: This is my conversation.  I'll say what I fucking please.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Wake up.  Make a right at Ocean Avenue.  The hotel's a few blocks up on the left.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: What if they do question the authenticity?

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Oh.  Seems yours girlfriend is casting doubts on your expertise.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: I am not!  Fuck you!  Theo's a genius.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Any trouble, we whip out our Treasury Department badges -- show them the wire I'm wearing and read them their rights.  Theo seizes the Krugerands as evidence. Naturally they start negotiating. Offer to give us up somebody else. And we listen.  Take notes on who bought what stolen art and tell them we have to clear it with our superiors at Justice.  We pick up their passports -- escort them to their room and leave them all in the bathroom handcuffed to the plumbing.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Who's on the phone?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'll explain later.  I'm sort of on hold.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: What was that for?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You could've made me lose my call.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: So what?  What could be important enough to put your hands on me?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I didn't hurt you.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: You couldn't hurt me.  But it's the principle.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Say something ...

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Me, he won't stay on the phone with for five fucking minutes without bitching.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm trying to help somebody. Okay?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: He's at it again.  Like that night at the Emerald.  This piece of Euro-trash is slapping shit out of his little wife in a back booth -- so Mr. Good Deed here has got to step in and pound the fucker's head into the wall.  Meantime "Wifey" recovers enough to pull off her high heel and nearly take our hero's eye out.  It took six stitches.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How was I in the wrong?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I know where it is.  Give me that phone back.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: I'm not finished.  Under other circumstances I'd gladly go out of my way.  I don't understand why you just don't phone some other person.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She can't!  It's busted.  Now hand that on back!

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Theo wants to talk again.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Did you have to tell her my name?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: Will you two cut it out?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: This Mercedes of yours, what's it look like?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: He's right, Theo.  She might not be around to back up your story. You could end up in the middle of this.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Look -- I've got the lives of maybe three innocent people hanging on the end of this line.

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: I know you feel awful but it's not your responsibility.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then whose is it?

turns.speaker: CAITLIN
turns.text: You gotta just look the other way.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm sorry.  You'll do all right without me.  Keep my share.

turns.speaker: COP'S VOICE
turns.text: Are you guys all right?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: You could've killed us.

turns.speaker: COP'S VOICE
turns.text: It was the fugitive in the Chrysler that caused this.  We were trying to overtake him.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: No reason to kill innocent bystanders.  Shit.  I can't hardly move my neck.

turns.speaker: COP'S VOICE
turns.text: We've already got an ambulance on the way.  Don't try to get out.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I'm not staying in here with him puking all over the place.  Get this door open!

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Now that'd be a misdemeanor.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I got to get going.  An agent is showing me a house up on Broad Beach in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: They'll wait.  Meantime, raise the lid.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What'd you do?  Tail me from Brentwood?

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Why would I do that?

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Let's have your license, mister.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm going to level with you officer.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: See for yourself, federal agent, U.S. Treasury.  On the job.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Lady, don't let him do it!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You got it wrong.  I'm the one that's on your side.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: You almost brain me and lock me in a fucking trunk and you're on my side?  You stupid fuck!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nels reporting in.  Sit down where you are.  Arms folded.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: In case you crapped out it was my job to go after that briefcase.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Or relieve me of it later.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Only I was sloppy.  I let you take me out.  That was quite a humiliation.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You missed.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Any time you decide to let me in on it.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: How do we get back to the freeway?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Bear right till the fire road ends.  It's not far.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yeah, I suppose getting whacked has got to be one of your best ways to die.  Particularly if you're not expecting it.  You don't know what hit you.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Can you make him stop!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Mind letting me make the best of a rotten situation?

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Which is why we had a lot more to worry about than the law.  These are people who don't worry about reading you your rights.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm the one they'd be looking for.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: I told you I should've cuffed him.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I want the gun emptied.  I want to see all six slugs tossed up here. And then I want out.  That's all. <u>OUT</u>!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He's seen both of us now.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Look, I've got a wife.  I don't care if either of you ever get caught.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What else did you expect him to say?  Do it, Theo -- or give me the gun.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: It took you long enough to get my ass out.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: With all those holes Nels pumped in I knew you wouldn't suffocate.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: You can tell she was really worried about me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I prefer to have the sucker die at a more convenient location.  Once Nels arrives with his backpack full of goodies.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: So Theo and Nels will appear to have whacked each other out and we never existed.  A thing of beauty. Jesus, the shit you come up with!

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: Now turn around.  I'm going to cuff you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Put those away.  We can't have marks on his wrists.

turns.speaker: GRILLO
turns.text: You never miss a trick.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'll see that he stays calm.  Pack the money up and put it in the trunk.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: You switched license plates?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's taken care of.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: We have never worked a gig together but I am a firm believer in preparation.  So let's go over this again step by step.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Not this minute.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: That was definitely out of line and totally unprovoked.  I heard you were a hitter.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: That's your "rep."

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Wait!  I hear her breathing now. There, she just picked it up again.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: What do you mean tip the cops?  Is the man a lunatic or what?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Will you relax?  This in no way affects our business.  Go on.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Just hand up on the bitch!  Fuck you, madam.  And goodbye!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's what I deserve for listening in the first place.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't like anybody laying their hands on me.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Just like they say; no fucking self control.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If you know that just back off.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Shit.  There's the hotel.  You overshot the driveway.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: And stop with the directions.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Make a "U" and go back.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's illegal.  You want us pulled over?  I'll turn around at the corner if you'll shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: <u>You're</u> doing all the talk.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: We still gotta run the drill before we walk in that lobby.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Go ahead then.  I'm covering the receiver.  She can't hear.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: First off, this Mr. Chow Yen doesn't speak a lot of English. The girl with him will interpret. There will be a third person to accompany you into the men's room where you can take count.  I hope you know Krugerands better than they know a <u>Hockney</u>.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I improved on the fucking original.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Let's hope so.  Once you come out and okay everything I'll give Caitlin the sign that she can bring the painting on over.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's rolled up in the tube on the floor back there.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Got your badge?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Satisfied, Wiseass?

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: In any event, whatever occurs you do not belt anybody.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What do you keep making me out to be?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Okay, okay, Lenore, calm down. Either let me call the school or better yet, the F.B.I.

turns.speaker: KLINGER
turns.text: Sure -- and they record your voice.  And later on we all get slammed for kidnap and murder. That's out!

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I thought you said you could handle him.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm doing fine.  Theo wants to deal.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Nels, don't let that cop pass you.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: What am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Lose the hardware now.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: We'll toss it when we make the blind curve.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Don't fuck around.  Pop a cap in him.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Allow me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He took it like a man.  Toss him in that drainage ditch.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: There's a taxi stand here.  I can meet you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Nels?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I'm still in my cab -- jammed up in traffic.  Are you there yet?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Any minute.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I was worried about you.  Both of you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: We've had our share of fuck-ups but it's going to work out fine.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Give me 20 minutes at least.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I've been trying to get someone -- anyone.  For hours ...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If this is some sales pitch I'm not buying --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You don't understand.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No.  <u>You</u> don't understand!  You caught me on my cellular on the way to pick up some business associates.  And I've got no time to screw around.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Will you let me explain!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: And what're you whispering for?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I can't talk any louder.  They might hear.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Lady, try making some sense.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You may be our only chance.  I don't know if I can do this again.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What'd you do!  Just pick my number out of the air?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They smashed the phone.  I've been clicking the loose wires together hoping it'd make a connection.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who smashed the phone?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They're holding my husband downstairs.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sure.  And they left you upstairs to make phone calls?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They gave me pills to make me sleep.  They didn't realize how much Seconal I'm used to -- that I'd have so much tolerance --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well I'm not tolerant of being bothered with this bullshit story when I'm about to make the most important score of my life.  This has gotta be some "put-on," right?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm so sorry to do this to you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're not doing anything to me -- because -- listen to this carefully -- I do not care.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're the one who's not to be believed.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: My name is --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't want to know --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: My name is Lenore Oberfeld.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't expect me to tell you who I am.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I realize you don't want to be involved.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I am not involved.  Keep clicking your little wires.  You'll get someone else.  Good luck.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You won't disconnect.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Oh won't I?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Because you know you'll be killing us.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't lay this on me!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Then hang up!  Do it!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why would anybody want to hurt you?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They tortured my husband.  Made him give them the pin numbers of our accounts.  Once they get what's in the safe deposit box they'll kill us.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where'd they take you to?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I have no idea.  They put us in the back of a van with blacked out windows.  The shutters up here are nailed shut.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well isn't there a number on the goddam phone?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No -- nothing.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Okay.  The police are gonna need your full name and address.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No!  No police.  They'll know right away the authorities are looking for us.  They'll kill us. We've seen their faces.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The cops could trace this call back to you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: One of them <u>is</u> a cop.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He pulled us over as we left the Riviera Tennis Club.  Claimed we'd run a stop sign.  And when Elliot was reaching for his license --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Elliot -- our driver.  The officer put his gun to the back of Elliot's head and -- fired.  It was so quick.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Oh man.  These people mean business.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Then they took the Mercedes away -- with his body in it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Listen, there's an overpass coming up.  I may lose you for a minute.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No don't.  You could lose me for good.  Don't go through that tunnel.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm in traffic.  There's no place to turn.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Fine, no tunnel.  Are you still with me?  Hello?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I hear them coming upstairs.  I won't be able to talk for awhile. I have to lay the phone down and pretend to be asleep.  So don't talk.  Don't say a word or they'll hear it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I can't stay on this line.  I'm picking people up.  I'm already overdue.  Hello?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm fine.  She's back on.  Hello?  I'm here.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They just walked out.  The smaller man -- he must be Dominican or Haitian -- he kicked me so hard. I felt a rib crack but I never made a sound.  It's starting to hurt now -- real bad.  A throbbing.  I can't even take a deep breath.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't move around.  You don't want to puncture a lung.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm with two friends now.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Rachel!  They're going after Rachel now -- and I can't stop them.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Stop throwing names at me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Rachel, my daughter.  She's an honor student at Parker.  My God, she's only nine.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What do they need her for?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They know Jack will give them what they want once they have her.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Bottom line!  There's nothing I can do for you but tip the cops.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The bigger man is driving our Mercedes to the school.  Rachel will recognize the car.  She'll get right in.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Let me call the school -- tell them not to let her go.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They don't know you.  They won't listen.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He's right.  You'll get my whole family killed.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's right?  Look, don't try to put blood on my hands.  You've got one hell of a nerve siding with him!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: "Theo?"

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Forget who I am.  Where's this school located?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: 26th off Wilshire.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Even if I got there first she wouldn't go with me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: She would if she heard my voice on the phone.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Why isn't anyone answering me?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Just hang on.  I've got a life of my own.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Will you please speak to me! Theo?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Another minute.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Hello?  It's just me and you again.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What about the others?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I kind of dropped them off.  They were getting on my nerves.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What are you doing now?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What do you think I'm doing?  I'm on my way to the school like you wanted.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Forget about us.  Just save Rachel.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell me what she looks like.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They say she resembles me -- dark hair, ponytail, very dark eyes. They all wear the same uniform.  Please.  Be careful.  The man driving the car must have a gun.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not looking to get myself killed.  I just hope the battery on this phone holds out.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where's the fucking recharger cord?  Must be in her car, dammit.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: How much time do you have left on it?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't know.  80 or 90 minutes, tops.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Why didn't you do what your friends wanted and just -- get rid of me?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't know.  I hung up on somebody else a long time ago, and later on I wished I hadn't of.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: A woman?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Hey drop it, okay?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I didn't mean to open up any old wounds.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It never healed.  I called her a lying bitch and everything else and I hung up on her.  "Click." You don't exist.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: And that was the end of it?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I sure as hell got my wish.  She doesn't exist.  So maybe you reached the appropriate person after all.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm sorry if I caused you to lose your business deal.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well you did.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What do you do for a living?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sometimes I paint.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Our house always needs touching up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Pictures.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I didn't mean to insult you. You're an artist.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They say my work is somewhat derivative.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I suppose if you're a struggling artist you need a patron.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Lady, you don't have to keep up a running commentary.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm afraid if I stop talking I'll lose you.  Just name any reasonable amount and it's yours.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Shit, stop with the money!  I never asked for a nickel.  I was just doing this.  And you have to fuck it up with a price tag.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I didn't mean to.  It's just the way I am.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: A price on everything.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I wasn't always like that.  I don't think I was.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm about ten blocks from the school.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I have no right to ask for help. I've never thought of anybody but myself.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That makes two of us.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You're breaking up.  I can't hear you.  Theo?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: There are cables overhead.  Hang on.  It'll clear up.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I've lost you.  You're gone.  I can't hear anything.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Make a right.  You can't miss it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm making my turn.  I see the school up ahead.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Lenore, I'm here.  I'm getting out.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I can hear you again, clearly.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Great.  Stay with me.  There must be a hundred kids out here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Does she have a red ribbon on that ponytail?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: That's not her.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Does she wear glasses?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I've got to ask somebody.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She's gone --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Don't say anything.  Don't alarm them.  Just go!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm trying to.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's copying down my license -- for all the good it'll do him.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: It's not your fault, Theo.  You tried.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I should've put them out of the car and come sooner!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: When Jack sees they've got Rachel HE'LL tell them what they want to know.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You said they wanted to get into some particular safety deposit box?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The one in Brentwood.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What bank?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The City National on San Vincente.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Wait just a minute.  Our luck has changed.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Black Mercedes, 600S.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not doing too well.  What's the matter?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I heard someone pulling in behind the house.  I heard Rachel screaming and then she stopped all of a sudden.  I don't know what they did to her.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Which means you can't be more than five or ten minutes from here.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Even if you found us -- what then?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm cutting across to Bundy to Brentwood.  That bank is our best bet.  If anybody shows up I could follow them.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Jack will negotiate with them. He'll identify the right key and give them the information they need to gain access and they'll let Rachel go.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Not a chance.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Don't say that.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Do you know what's in that box?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm not supposed to -- but I do. Millions in cash and bearer bonds.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They'll recognize it's not your husband.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Jack was only at that branch once when he took the box years ago.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They've still got to be able to sign his name.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: It's not hard to do.  I do it all the time.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm pretty good at signatures myself.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Oh my God.  I heard her scream again.  What are they doing to her?  Why can't I do anything to stop them?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're doing what you can.  Why's all this money stashed?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: To hide it from the I.R.S.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How come everybody turns out to be a crook?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Don't talk.  Don't talk!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The front door slammed.  Someone went out.  There's a different car starting.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I might still get there first. The lights are with me.  How would I identify the guy who shows up at the bank?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: If it's the tall man -- he had one of those hair transplants.  Tufts, you know.  It still hasn't grown fully in.  The other one is from the islands.  Braided hair -- very dark.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It won't be him.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Theo, I want you to know, you're probably the most decent man I've ever met.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yeah, sure that's me.  Ask anybody.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: But I guess we haven't really met -- have we?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I've got a lot of respect for you too.  For the way you feel about your family.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Jack hasn't loved me for years. And now I'm afraid she's turning out to be like him.  So cold and distant.  I've let him make her like that.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why tell me this?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Because you're probably the last person I'll ever talk to.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You can't give up.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: When they first started questioning Jack -- he answered them in that tone he usually reserves for me.  And they began beating him.  And I watched.  And I didn't feel anything ... What kind of a person am I?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Did you jiggle the phone?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Did you hear that click?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Yes -- I think so.  Another crossed line?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Or somebody else there is listening in --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Downstairs.  There must be an extension.  Oh my God --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't panic.  I might be wrong.  Hello?  I guess I was wrong.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No.  I hear them.  They're coming upstairs.  They know!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Try what you did before.  It worked before.  I won't talk anymore.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Yes?  Yes?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Hi Lenore.  It's me.  I got you back.  Courtesy of Star 69.  Are you hurt?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They dragged me downstairs.  I thought they were going to kill me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Lucky for them they didn't.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: What did you do?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I had a little encounter at the bank and our Mr. Transplant ended up under the wheels of a Chevy.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: God, if he doesn't come back --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm in possession of the bag he was carrying.  And I'm in a position to negotiate.  What about your husband and your child?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They're tied with duct tape so they can't speak -- but they seem to be --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Thank you.  God bless you for helping us.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They wrapped tape around my wrists and ankles.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's coming off.  How about the girl?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: She's awake but she hasn't spoken. I don't know what they did to her. I don't want to think about it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Your husband?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He's in back.  Lying face down. They haven't hurt him anymore -- but he was crying.  I never heard Jack cry before --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're all three of you in that van?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Now you're going to do just what I tell you to.  No discussion.  No hesitation.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Put the man back on.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Lenore -- you promised you'd follow instructions.  We're almost there.  Simply get out when they slide the van open and walk to me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm not leaving my daughter behind.  Not with them.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She's next.  In two or three more minutes she'll be free.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I can't do it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't start thinking about it.  Is the tape off?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Can you walk?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Yes.  But I want Rachel to come with me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They won't allow that.  It's one at a time.  And you have to be first.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Why can't it be her?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She's a child.  She might panic. She doesn't know me.  She might not come to me.  She might just run.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: All right.  Now that you explain it I see that you're right.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Once you're in the car with me she's sure to come to us.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  You've thought this out better than I ever could.  I'm ready now.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Rachel -- Oh my God.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Just start walking.  Come on. Walk to me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: It's locked.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Shit.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Rachel was terrified when I left her.  I could see it in her eyes.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She'll be with you soon.  They're pulling up.  They'll realize I kept my part of the bargain.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: She'll never be the same.  None of us will.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Include me in that.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Now I have -- it's a long story.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Why didn't you just shoot them?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Because a lot of people would've gotten killed.  Probably all the wrong ones.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You're going to let them get away with this?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: We've almost got your husband and your daughter out.  So don't get any ideas.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They tortured us.  And you're going to let them have all that money?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: So far they're keeping their part of it.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They put their hands all over me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Somehow I got along better with you on the phone.  It's all there isn't it?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: For Christ sakes don't point it at me.  We want to get Rachel out of there in one piece.  I'm waiting for the girl.  Her mother wants to talk to her.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Hand me the phone.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He had a gun.  I have it now.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why are you telling him that.  Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The rest of the money is here in the car.  Why don't you come and get it?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're not Lenore Oberfeld.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: There isn't any such person.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Whose money is this?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: It belongs to the man you took it from.  Or should I saw <u>stole</u> it from?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The guy with the transplant.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Jack Oberfeld in person.  Did you kill him?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Damned if I know.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The video cameras will put you with him in the bank, and I'll bet there were enough witnesses.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: At least one.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Plus they'll remember you going after his daughter at school.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You timed that beautifully.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They always pick Rachel up early on Thursday.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I got what I fucking deserved.  I had it all.  I could've kept going!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: As they say -- no good deed goes unpunished.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: And all that crap about your driver being murdered by a cop --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I thought it was inspired.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: There was <u>no</u> cop involved.  Oh shit!  Fuck!

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Sit completely still with both hands on the wheel -- until they get here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why pick me to be your "mark?"

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Nobody's easier to con than a con man.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You knew about me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Who's in back?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: L.A.P.D.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Shit.  You couldn't be in much worse shape.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Your friends are probably still on the line.  Pick it up and say hello.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: There's no way out for you.  You have to deal with us.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Assure them that you're being well treated.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell them I'm keeping what's left. I earned it.  I probably killed some poor bastard for it.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He seems to think he's entitled to it all.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Not all.  They already have a third.  The question is how much of that are they willing to give to get you back?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You won't shoot me.  That's not your style.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: We might hit a bump and the gun might go off.  Ever see that Tarantino movie -- where Travolta blew that guy away in the back seat -- purely by accident?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Do you have to point that?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Absolutely.  And Topanga Canyon has a hell of a lot of potholes if I recall.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He seems to be headed for Topanga.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not trying to lose them.  Nor am I exceeding any speed limits.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The one thing you don't want is to attract the police.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Granted, the cops are not an alternative.  Certainly not with one of their own still locked in my trunk.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I don't hear him moving around anymore.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Those shots your associates got off may not have done him too much good.  That's on their head.  All I did I was put him there.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: A typical fuck-up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's that supposed to me?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I knew you were a loser the first night I laid eyes on you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You, I would've noticed.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Oh no, you were too busy trying to keep some Croatian from slapping the shit out of his girlfriend. She showed her gratitude by almost taking your eye out with her spiked heel.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You were at the Emerald that night?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Naturally you didn't learn your lesson.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I guess I ought to stop seeing woman as victims.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I think it was my tone of voice more than anything else that sold you.  And when you thought I was being kicked around, I wish I could've seen your face.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're enjoying this too much.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Now you're starting to sound like a victim again.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You could've hit me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Only in the leg or the thigh. You'd live but you just wouldn't wear shorts.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You wouldn't --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yes I would.  Not kill you.  But blow off a few toes, absolutely. I'm entitled to that as retribution.  It'll help you to remember me in years to come -- every time you put on stockings. They must have prosthetic toes by now -- with little nails on them you can polish --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Stop talking like that!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then scream for me.  A repeat performance.  Let me see how easy you can turn it on.  Scream!  I want to hear you scream for me!
